vision.notes: Likely present in most species, though potentially reduced or absent in deep-sea or trench-dwelling species. Further research needed to determine the range of visual capabilities across the family.

mechanoreception.notes: Lateral line system and inner ear for detecting water movement and pressure changes. Important for prey detection, predator avoidance, and spatial orientation in a variety of depths and habitats.

chemoreception.notes: Olfactory and gustatory senses for detecting chemical cues in the water. Important for locating food, identifying mates, and avoiding harmful substances. Assumed based on general fish biology.
